timeline.bodyText: Why talk about the required behavior of validSystemNameFormat() here, when it's already covered in the Javadoc for that method?
timeline.author: bobjacobsen
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -199,8 +195,9 @@ public default String validateSystemNameFormat(@Nonnull String name) throws BadS * Overriding implementations may rely on * {@link #validSystemNameFormat(java.lang.String)}, however they must * provide an actionable message in the thrown exception if that method does - * not return {@link NameValidity#VALID}. Implementations of - * this method must not throw an exception, log an error, or + * not return {@link NameValidity#VALID}. When overriding implementations + * of this method rely on validSystemNameFormat(), implementations of

replies.bodyText:
Prior to 4.17.2, implementations of validSystemNameFormat() did present dialogs, throw runtime exceptions, and log errors about the validity of the system name. It was a bit of a mess.
I'm not claiming that those implementations are wrong, just that if they do that, they can't be relied upon within this method, since spamming a log with error messages or interrupting a user typing a name won't be appreciated by users.
replies.author: rhwood
